edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit

Interface GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GarbledBooleanCircuit
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp

    public interface GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
extends GarbledBooleanCircuit
    This interface is an extension for the basic garbled boolean circuit, GarbledBooleanCircuit.

    The goal was to keep the basic garbled circuit as much simple as possible, and put all the extended possibilities and features in a different interface.

    This interface should be used in the case of malicious adversaries, thus it adds some related functions.

    The most important features here are:

    1. The ability to set the input or/and output garbled values.

    2. The ability to sample the garbled values using a given seed.

    There are also some additional verify function that matches these features.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Method Detail

      • setInputKeys

        void setInputKeys(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> inputValues)
        Gets the input keys, which are the input garbled values and sets them. This way when calling the garble function the input values will not be sampled but taken from the given values.
        Parameters:
        inputValues - contains both garbled values for each input wire.

      • setOutputKeys

        void setOutputKeys(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> outputValues)
        Gets the output keys, which are the output garbled values and sets them. This way when calling the garble function the output values will not be sampled but taken from the given values.
        Parameters:
        outputValues - contains both garbled values for each output wire.

      • getHashedCircuit

        byte[] getHashedCircuit(CryptographicHash hash)
        Compute the hash function on the garbled tables and translation table of the circuit.
        Parameters:
        hash - CryptographicHash function object to use.
        Returns:
        The result of the hash function on the circuit.

      • verifyHashedCircuit

        boolean verifyHashedCircuit(CryptographicHash hash,
                          byte[] hashedCircuit)
        Verifies that the given hashedCircuit is indeed the result of the given hash on the circuit's garbled tables and translation table.
        Parameters:
        hash - CryptographicHash function object to use.
        hashedCircuit - A byte array that suppose to be the result of the hash function on the circuit.
        Returns:
        true if the given hashedCircuit is indeed the result of the hash function of the circuit; False, otherwise.

      • verify

        boolean verify(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues,
             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allOutputWireValues)
        The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

        Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

        This verify function is the same as the verify(Map allInputWireValues) but also check that the resulted output garbled values are equal to the given allOutputWireValues.

        Parameters:
        allInputWireValues - A Map containing both keys for each input wire. For each input wire index, the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
        allOutputWireValues - A Map containing both keys for each output wire. The generated output garbled values are checked against these values to see if they are equal. For each output wire index, the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

      • verify

        boolean verify(byte[] seed,
             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputGarbledValues,
             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allOutputGarbledValues,
             CryptographicHash hash,
             byte[] hashedCircuit)
               throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

        Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

        This verify function samples the keys using the given seed, then compute the hash function on the circuit's garbled tables and translation table and check that the result is equal to the given hashedCircuit.

        Parameters:
        seed - to use in order to generate the keys.
        allInputGarbledValues - A map containing both keys for each input wire. Should be null in case the user set no input garbled values before garbling.
        allOutputGarbledValues - A map containing both keys for each output wire. Should be null in case the user set no output garbled values before garbling.
        hash - CryptographicHash object to use.
        hashedCircuit - A byte array that suppose to be the result of the hash function on the circuit.
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended is a garbling the given seed, false if it is not.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
